title: Sri Lanka’s anti-ragging law ignored
byline: The death of a student at Sabaragamuwa University by suicide over reasons allegedly linked to ragging sparks concerns over the lack of awareness of anti-ragging legislation and its enforcement, according to officials.

title: Will have to increase power tariff or face delay in 5th IMF tranche: Sagala
byline: The government is facing a dilemma as it must either increase the power tariff or face a delay in receiving the fifth tranche under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF) agreement signed with the IMF, United National Party (UNP) National Organiser Sagala Ratnayake said yesterday.

title: Three-member committee to probe into Sabaragamuwa Uni student’s death
byline: A three-member committee has been appointed to investigate the sudden death of a second-year student at the Sabaragamuwa University, who reportedly committed suicide following an alleged incident of ragging.

title: Australians head to polls amid economic concerns
byline: Polls have opened on Australia’s general election day, with millions of voters expected to cast their ballots to decide the composition of the 48th federal parliament.

title: Suspect arrested over shooting of Dan Priyasad
byline: A 52-year-old suspect has been arrested in connection with the shooting of Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Local Council candidate Dan Priyasad, police said.

title: Yevan Dominates on Euroformula Debut
byline: Seventeen-year-old Yevan David made a spectacular entry into the 2025 Euroformula Open Championship, with a stunning performance at the season-opener in Portimão, Portugal.

title: Vehicle revenue license counters in Western Province to be closed on May 5, 6
byline: The issuing of vehicle revenue licenses in the Western Province will be suspended on May 5 and 6 due to the Local Government elections, the Provincial Chief Secretary said.

title: Electricity tariffs will be increased in June: President
byline: The electricity tariffs will be increased in the next tariff revision in June, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said.

title: India bans imports from Pakistan amid tension over tourist killings
byline: India said it has banned the import of goods originating from or transiting via Pakistan as diplomatic tensions between the two nuclear-armed nations flared in the wake of a deadly attack on tourists in disputed Kashmir region.

title: SriLankan flight subjected to security search at BIA after Chennai alert
byline: SriLankan Airlines said that Flight UL 122, operated by aircraft 4R-ALS, arrived in Colombo from Chennai at 11:59 hrs today, underwent a comprehensive security inspection upon arrival.

title: Dan Priyasad murder case suspect detained
byline: A suspect was today ordered to be detained for a period of 48 hours following his arrest over the murder of social activist Dan Priyasad.

title: Task force to curb spread of Dengue, Chikungunya
byline: A special task force has been appointed to control the spread of dengue and chikungunya, according to Dr. L.A. Kalukapuarachchi, Secretary to the Ministry of Health of the Western Provincial Council.

title: Anti-corruption drive launched at DMT
byline: A bold anti-corruption initiative has been officially launched at the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT), marking a significant step toward transparency and accountability in one of the country’s most publicly accessed institutions, Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Minister Bimal Rathnayake said.

title: Probe on Sabaragamuwa University ragging incident handed over to CID
byline: The investigations into the ragging incident at the Sabaragamuwa University have been handed over to the Criminal Investigations Department (CID).

title: Sri Lanka-born Cassandra Fernando re-elected to Australian Parliament
byline: Sri Lankan-born Cassandra Fernando has been re-elected to the Australian Parliament following the federal election.

title: Gem and Jewellery industry sounds alarm on US tariff threat to gem jobs
byline: Sri Lanka’s gem and jewellery industry could face severe economic fallout if the United States moves ahead with the proposed reciprocal tariff, the Sri Lanka Gem and Jewellery Association (SLGJA) cautioned.

title: NIC services suspended on May 6, 7 due to LG elections
byline: Due to the Local Government (LG) elections scheduled for May 6, the one-day services, including other social services offered by the Department for Registration of Persons, will not be available for two days.

title: President departs for Vietnam
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake left for Vietnam a short while ago on an official state visit, the Presidential Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Australia’s PM Albanese re-elected for second term
byline: Anthony Albanese has secured a stunnifederal election win while delivering a devastating result for the Coalition that cost Peter Dutton his own seat.

title: SL fears socio-economic crisis as US tariff hikes threaten rubber exports: SLAMERP
byline: A proposed increase in US tariff rates on rubber products could devastate Sri Lanka’s export sector, risking 150,000 livelihoods and destabilising rural economies,  Sri Lanka Association of Manufacturers and Exporters of Rubber Products (SLAMERP) Chairman Pushpika Jamnadhira cautioned.

title: Chikungunya treatment may endanger Dengue patients
byline: Sri Lankan health officials have warned the public about the dangers of treating chikungunya without proper diagnosis, as it can be life-threatening for dengue patients. With both diseases spreading fast due to the rainy season, they urge people to seek medical help early.
